description:
Simultaneously apply anomalous fluxes of windstress, heat and freshwater using the passive-tracer method for heat as in the faf-heat experiment.
Impose pre-industrial atmospheric conditions. Branch from the piControl at the same point as the 1pctCO2 experiment.
keywords: FAFMIP, Tier 2, surface wind stress anomaly, surface heat flux anomaly, surface freshwater anomaly
long_name: control plus perturbative surface fluxes of momentum, heat and water into ocean
rationale: For comaprison with individual surface flux anomalies.

requirements.description: Impose zonal and meridional momentum flux (wind stress) anomalies to the ocean surface, created from the CMIP5 diagnostics of surface downward fluxes of eastward (tauu) and northward (tauv) momentum. The surface flux anomalies are calculated from the ensemble mean of the CMIP5 1pctCO2 simulations at the time of CO2 doubling.  Surface flux anomalies (a function of longitude, latitude and time of year) are to remain constant throughout the experiment.  Note that the fluxes themselves are not replaced because this would typically cause a very large climate drift and possible instability. The stress perturbation is added to the momentum balance of the ocean water surface, it should not directly perturb any turbulent mixing scheme that depends on the windstress and should not be applied to the sea-ice momentum balance, although presumably the sea-ice velocity will be indirectly affected.
requirements.keywords: FAFMIP, 1pctCO2, wind stress, 2xCO2, at CO2 doubling
requirements.label: 1pctCO2 Wind Stress Anomaly At Doubling

requirements.description: Impose heat flux anomalies to the ocean surface, created from the CMIP5 diagnostic of surface downward heat flux in sea-water (hfds).  The surface heat-flux anomalies are calculated from the ensemble mean of the CMIP5 1pctCO2 simulations at the time of CO2 doubling.  Surface flux anomalies (a function of longitude, latitude and time of year) are to remain constant throughout the experiment.  Note that the fluxes themselves are not replaced because this would typically cause a very large climate drift and possible instability.  The method for implementing the heat flux anomaly should follow that used by Bouttes and Gregory (2014).
requirements.keywords: FAFMIP, 1pctCO2, heat flux, 2xCO2, at CO2 doubling
requirements.label: 1pctCO2 Heat Flux Anomaly At Doubling

requirements.description: Add a surface flux of passive tracer at the same rate as the surface heat flux perturbation in the faf-heat experiment.  The passive tracer flux will be added to the top layer of a passive temperature tracer.  Surface flux anomalies (a function of longitude, latitude and time of year) are to remain constant throughout the experiment.  The method for implementing the passive tracer should follow that used by Bouttes and Gregory (2014).
requirements.keywords: FAFMIP, 1pctCO2, heat flux, passive tracer, 2xCO2, at CO2 doubling
requirements.label: 1pctCO2 Passive Tracer At Doubling

requirements.canonical_name: 1pctCO2 Fresh Water Flux Anomaly At Doubling
requirements.description: Impose surface freshwater flux anomalies to the ocean (including the contribution from runoff change), created from the CMIP5 diagnostic of water flux into sea water (wfo).  The surface freshwater flux is calculated from the ensemble mean of the CMIP5 1pctCO2 simulations at the time of CO2 doubling.  Surface flux anomalies (a function of longitude, latitude and time of year) are to remain constant throughout the experiment.   Note that the fluxes themselves are not replaced because this would typically cause a very large climate drift and possible instability.
requirements.keywords: FAFMIP, 1pctCO2, freshwater flux, 2xCO2, at CO2 doubling
requirements.label: 1pctCO2 Fresh Water Flux Anomaly At Doubling

requirements.keywords: Pre-industrial forcing, excluding carbon dioxide, excluding co2
requirements.label: Pre-Industrial Forcing Excluding CO2

requirements.description: Initialisation is made from year 20 of the pre-industrial control.
requirements.label: PreIndustrialInitialisation

requirements.description: Use a coupled Atmosphere-Ocean general circulation model
requirements.label: AOGCM Configuration
